title: Quiche West Central (2011) New Testament
title_vernacular: Quiché Occidental Central (2011) Nab'ey Tzij Rech Ri Cristo
description:
Kʼicheʼ, or Quiché, is a Mayan language of Guatemala, spoken by the Kʼicheʼ people of the central highlands. With over a million speakers (some 7% of Guatemala's population), Kʼicheʼ is the second most widely-spoken language in the country, after Spanish. It is also the most widely-spoken indigenous American language in Mesoamerica.

The Central dialect is the most commonly used in media and education. Despite a low literacy rate, Kʼicheʼ is increasingly taught in schools and used on the radio.

language.name: K'iche'
